intro: Malapoenna fuscescens, commonly known as the dark-stemmed malapoenna, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often followed by oval-shaped fruits. This species is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
